thread.title: Stephen Curry moves into 10th place on NBA’s all-time made 3-pointers list
thread.title_full: Stephen Curry moves into 10th place on NBA’s all-time made 3-pointers list

title: Stephen Curry moves into 10th place on NBA’s all-time made 3-pointers list
text:
Mar 5, 2017 at 5:32p ET 0Shares 
Stephen Curry ranks both first and second in NBA history for the most three-pointers made in a single season, so we shouldn’t be surprised to see how quickly he’s rocketing up the all-time list. 
After knocking down this triple early in the third quarter on Sunday against the Knicks, Curry passed Chauncey Billups to move into 10th place for most career three-pointers made with 1,831. With this 3, Steph Curry passes Chauncey Billups for 10th on the all-time three pointers made list! pic.twitter.com/43jaXTqVMQ 
— NBA (@NBA) March 5, 2017 
Billups played 17 NBA seasons; Curry isn’t even finished with his eighth. The reigning MVP averages almost four made threes per game this season, and with 20 games remaining, he’ll have a chance to pass Joe Johnson’s total of 1,903 to move into sole possession of ninth place on the list before the season is finished.
